channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The temporary traffic lights before the Esso Garage are dangerous, 8th July
item.description:
The path leading to the road maintenance has caused no proper crossing to be available for pedestrians and cyclists and is therefore causing a danger . When trying to cross from Purton Lane to the other side of Cheltenham Road East, there is no facility to cross the road and children with parents and young children are attempting to cross a busy road where the traffic is not being controlled by the traffic lights. This is dangerous as people are running in front of traffic to enable them to cross.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 8th July
item.description:
Give and take plus temporary footway closure footway abrupt level difference around raised cover in grass verge. 28 day. 1.1m x 1.2m x 30mm tarmac patch required. (FW6 Abrupt Level Differences)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge needs cutting, 8th July
item.description:
Please do something about the overgrown hedges on both sides of Green St. The hedges need to be cut back substantially and not just trimmed. Those of us who live on this street are having our cars damaged by the twigs and overgrown bramble along the length of the narrow portion of the street. It is almost impossible to pass on the street without damage occurring. I also have a motorhome which has had to be professionally valeted due to scratches on the bodywork and windows. Please do not dismiss this issue as it is an increasing problem due to the increased traffic using the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Street, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 8th July

item.title: Major Health & Safety Issue Southam Road, 8th July
item.description:
Footpath leading to Sotham shown as closed when there is no alternative on the other side of the road forcing villagers to step in to fast moving traffic increased due to Evesham Road closure. I will contact the Health & Safety Executive about this issue unless the signs are removed immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shaw Green Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned signs cones & sandbags, 8th July
item.description:
These abandoned signs etc are restricting the only footpath on the Prestbury end of Southam Road. This is the second time Iâ€™ve reported this. Someone needs to manage your contractor Ringway as they are creating Health & Safety issues in Prestbury rather than solving problems.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southam Road, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Abandoned sign, 8th July
item.description:
Abandoned Ringway barrier & sandbag blocking crossing point. Original problem with raised hatch fixed by Environmental Agency weeks ago & reported to you. Is this what constitutes public service?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Morningside Close, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Subsidence in pavement-to-drainage ditch outside 27 Symphony Road, 8th July
item.description:
The previously reported cracks in the pavement outside my home at 27 Symphony Road have now deteriorated further. In the past few days the smaller part of the pavement is now raised and has clearly subsided towards the drainage ditch. In addition to this, my connection to our fibre internet box (on Messenger way) is now blocked below the path. Bt Openreach has also been informed. Thanks for your attention, Craige Hume 27 Symphony Road, Cheltenham, GL516GJ

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Symphony Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Single yellow lines., 8th July
item.description:
After the recent roadworks the line painting has only added single yellow lines on one of the most important / busiest junctions on the Leckhampton Road. All other junctions have double yellow lines yet this hasnâ€™t. The only exception. Double yellow lines were present beforehand. Ayou can see from the picture itâ€™s already causing problems and creating unnecessary risk when sight lines are obscured.

item.title: Large branch has fallen from height..over 10 metres, 8th July
item.description:
